learning_objectives.description: Describe collision theory in terms of: (a) number of particles per unit volume (b) frequency of collisions between particles (c) kinetic energy of particles (d) activation energy, Eₐ
State that a catalyst increases the rate of a reaction, decreases the activation energy, Eₐ, of a reaction and is unchanged at the end of a reaction

Describe and explain the effect on the rate of reactions of: (a) changing the concentration of solutions (b) changing the pressure of gases (c) changing the surface area of solids (d) changing the temperature (e) adding or removing a catalyst, including enzymes using collision theory
Describe and evaluate practical methods for investigating the rate of a reaction, including change in mass of a reactant or a product and the formation of a gas
Interpret data, including graphs, from rate of reaction experiments
